title: Macquarie Sports Radio to axe sports talk shows after 18 months
text:
Macquarie Sports Radio will be shut down its sports talk shows across the network, with redundancies expected, ending a venture that was launched 18 months but failed to attract the required audience and advertising.

Macquarie Sports Radio had been broadcasting AFL. Getty Images

Macquarie Media, which owns the three sports radio stations, will cut the sports talk shows from the network on Friday, November 1. Macquarie Sports Radio launched on April 4, 2018, with coverage of the Commonwealth Games on the Gold Coast. It acquired rights to a number of sports, including AFL, NRL and cricket.

The radio frequencies of the three stations will still be used for broadcasting sports matches and other content. The stations will not simply go dark and it's believed Nine will evaluate new plans for those frequencies once it has completed its takeover of the business.

"Macquarie Media Limited today announced that development of its Macquarie Sports Radio stations in Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane will be paused and reviewed over the summer months and that the current schedule of sport talk programs will cease as of 11pm, Friday, November 1," Macquarie chairman Russell Tate said.

“Over the coming months, Macquarie Sports Radio will continue live sport broadcasts including all scheduled Test match, BBL, one-day internationals and international T20 cricket matches as well as its English Premier League coverage.
